section.title: Target Startup Monitor test
section.para: Testing that the target startup monitor correctly identifies targets have started, and sets the Node State Manager's state accordingly.

section.title: Target units
section.para:
This testing requires the existence of focussed.target, unfocussed.target and lazy.target units.
If they do not exist, they can be created by executing the following:
cp /lib/systemd/system/{graphical,focussed}.target cp /lib/systemd/system/{graphical,unfocussed}.target cp /lib/systemd/system/{graphical,lazy}.target

section.title: Setting up DLT
section.para:
In addition, this test uses Diagnostic Log and Trace (DLT). It can be started and directed to a log file by executing the following:
dlt-daemon -d dlt-receive -o /tmp/dlt.log localhost &

section.title: Reading DLT log
section.para: To read this log file, execute dlt-convert -a /tmp/dlt.log This will display the contents of the log file in the following format: Index Time Timestamp Count Ecuid Apid Ctid Type Subtype Mode #Args Payload The fields we are interested in are the Apid (Application ID), Ctid (Context ID) and the Payload For example: 12 2012/08/01 10:30:32.247913 17066086 006 ECU1 NSC- CTRL log info V 1 [Active state of unit "node-startup-controller.service" changed to active]

section.title: Test Overview
section.para:
The following behaviours will be confirmed:
Starting the Node Startup Controller tries to change the Node State
Starting focussed.target tries to change the Node State
Starting unfocussed.target tries to change the Node State
Starting lazy.target tries to change the Node State
Stopping a target unit will not try to change the Node State

section.title: Test steps
section.para:
Starting the Node Startup Controller tries to change the Node State
systemctl start nsm-dummy.service systemctl start node-startup-controller.service
Read the DLT log and verify these entries appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSMD NSMC [Applied the node state 2: yes]
NSC- CTRL [Active state of unit "node-startup-controller.service" changed to active]
Starting focussed.target tries to change the node state
systemctl start focussed.target
Read the DLT log and verify these entries appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSC- CTRL [Creating D-Bus proxy for unit "/org/freedesktop/systemd1/unit/focussed_2etarget"]
NSC- CTRL [Active state of unit "focussed.target" changed to active]
NSMD NSMC [Applied the node state 3: no]
NSC- CTRL [Failed to set the node state: error code 2]
Starting unfocussed.target tries to change the node state
systemctl start unfocussed.target
Read the DLT log and verify these entries appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSC- CTRL [Creating D-Bus proxy for unit "/org/freedesktop/systemd1/unit/unfocussed_2etarget"]
NSC- CTRL [Active state of unit "unfocussed.target" changed to active]
NSMD NSMC [Applied the node state 4: yes]
Starting lazy.target tries to change the node state
systemctl start lazy.target
Read the DLT log and verify these entries appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSC- CTRL [Creating D-Bus proxy for unit "/org/freedesktop/systemd1/unit/lazy_2etarget"]
NSC- CTRL [Active state of unit "lazy.target" changed to active]
NSMD NSMC [Applied the node state 5: no]
NSC- CTRL [Failed to set the node state: error code 2]
Stopping a target unit will not try to change the node state
systemctl stop focussed.target
Read the DLT log and verify that these entries appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSC- CTRL [Creating D-Bus proxy for unit "/org/freedesktop/systemd1/unit/focussed_2etarget"]
NSC- CTRL [Active state of unit "focussed.target" changed to inactive]
Verify that these entries do not appear:
APID CTID Payload
NSMD NSMC [Applied the node state 3: yes]
